oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Country Music Hall of Fame Exhibit - How a Record is Born
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of various excerpts of the How a Record is Born recordings for the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum. The recordings are hosted by Frank Jones (personality). The recordings were used to describe the image presented in front of the audience, and used a 10kz impulse in order to advance to the next image. Exhibit was created for the original, Music Row, Country Music Hall of Fame. Recordings are from an unknown date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Frank Jones
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) 10kz impulse advancing tone -- (00:04) Frank Jones reflects on the processes involved in recording in a studio -- (03:01) Jim Malloy leads a studio session for: Bill Pursell, Kelso Herston, Bobby Dyson, D. J. Fontana, Joe Zinken, Fred Carter, Tommy Jackson, Pete Drake, and the Jordanaires -- (08:30) Jones performs his closing statement
